turns.text: Um what do you think the major cause of air pollution or at least in the Boston areas -
turns.label: qo

turns.text: Well the the the major cause it seems up here is exc- - I live right on the ocean so its kind of hard for me to tell what would happen if I lived in some of the valleys inland
turns.label: sd

turns.text: but the major cause here and we always seem to and it seems to be validated by the press is the car pollution We dont have too much industrial pollution
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Uh car pollution seems to be the one and only thing that that I can really put my finger on here
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Um that isnt the same in the Washington area because we dont have any major um industry except for uh government and services And the the transportation situation is such that uh all the car pollution is is absolutely awful Um also the worth of the hub of three airports - in this general area there is uh National Dulles and then uh Baltimore Washington And it - interestingly some of the information Ive been reading indicates that the amount of air pollution from uh uh airplanes is extraordinary
turns.label: sd

turns.text: and thats always something that you know you just dont real you dont think about
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Well most people talk about the noise pollution from airplanes rather than the air pollution
turns.label: sv

turns.text: But the uh - apparently the air pollution and the fact that its delivered right up in high altitudes --

I would think so You know uh i- I guess it talked about all types of pollution I happen to - just read something the other day at least in the Boston paper there were three things that that come to note One is that the carbon fluorides that are uh being released into the atmosphere are causing even larger hole in the southern hemisphere in the ozone layer and again - and now theyve located another one or la- rather an expanding one in the northern hemisphere So car- - so Im quite concerned I dont think its involved any longer with with uh hair sprays or those th- -
turns.label: aa

turns.text: No I think its now is what uh from what I understand its air conditioning units and and
turns.label: b

turns.text: we certainly turned into an air conditioned --
Yeah I know in Florida theres no place you go that isnt air conditioned and I do quite bit of business in Washington And -
turns.label: aa

turns.text: I mean you know what its like here -
turns.label: qw

turns.text: Oh yeah its quite - is is the un- - its really out of the norm not to find something that isnt air conditioned And -
turns.label: ny

turns.text: are the same way They release that
Thats right So solutions to this
turns.label: aa

turns.text: you know improved - Well I guess the fur- the to me the first thing is I wish society would get as upset about this as you do get getting people upset about animal rights

I mean this is so so basic Its human rights in the sense but uh in terms of demanding its just not caused - but demanding that uh we can spend so much money on certain things but that research really be directed toward um improvement of polluting vehicles and not just cars but also buses um planes That something can be done I me- I cant imagine that well
turns.label: sv

turns.text: if we cant send people to the moon
turns.label: sv

turns.text: that we cant improve these things -
No I think that it can be done simply because uh uh weve weve - every car now in America thats been produced for the past fifteen years has what they call catalytic converter
turns.label: b

turns.text: And no lead gas was came to the pumps And and thats been done Theres the lead pollution has that problem essentially I guess because it was at crisis proportions was
turns.label: sd

turns.text: was licked And I think that there are th- there are solutions
certainly we dont even need need research anymore Its just matter of passing the law and passing the law depends on how heavy the car industry the automobile lobby is
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Thats right Well and also to make it economically feasible
turns.label: aa

turns.text: Uh and per- ti- also in buses I dont know if you ever got caught in traffic jam behind bus
That that the the smell is awful and but you know I was reading the other day not to go on with this but that
turns.label: sv

turns.text: diesel fumes actually have less pollutants in them than gasoline fumes
So I guess youre better off sitting behind bus than car although I can never I could never uh really - - rationalize that while I was sitting there
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Yeah but even of course in the longer term just to get away from fossil fuels -
turns.label: aa

turns.text: I mean Im Im thinking of research in that direction rather than - we weve taken the intermediate step but I dont think
turns.label: sv

turns.text: -- up here in New England uh where Ive - right close to where I live is the Seabrook Nucleus site which is
practically you know guerilla war up here
went on for years Uh my daughters marched in the uh uh against the Seabrook and I kind of uh - my feelings were that we needed this bridge to
to uh to - - jump from whatever it was going to be from fossil fuel to whatever it was going to be
Yeah you dont throw the baby out with the bath water
turns.label: b

turns.text: Un- unfortunately though I think the oil companies have lied to us for years
turns.label: sv

turns.text: So we really dont know whether theres enough fossil fuel left or there isnt and uh and uh -
turns.label: sv

turns.text: But with the pollution issue uh fossil fuel is not the way to go anyway
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Uh so youve to lo- youve got to look elsewhere
turns.label: sv

turns.text: So uh but it is something thats little frightening and in fact well I - within our family we have said - my husband - I have two sons uh well one is already in college in New England
turns.label: sv

turns.text: and the other will be going in September and we just feel that when we leave uh this area - were going north not south
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Uh I like the mentality north and I also like the fresher air up there
turns.label: sd

turns.text: So I mean thats the way we will be going
turns.label: sd

turns.text: But um so I i- Id be interested in having spoken with somebody also from the far west on this issue to see how they their attitudes are
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Well since since Texas and Louisiana and uh California that in that ranking order the worst pollutants in America -
turns.label: sd

turns.text: I mean I read that the other day I mean Louisi- Louisiana for small state - it was amazing but its the industrial pollution I should imagine
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And California seems to be taking steps I mean you you read about the the fairly
turns.label: sv

turns.text: fairly stiff laws they put in on cars now theyre theyre enforcing
But uh again uh that didnt occur without crisis Nothing will occur I guess without crisis
turns.label: sv

turns.text: I mean even California was notorious for its smog years ago
turns.label: sv

turns.text: before it even was an issue

Well the greatest thing that happened to pollution in the last couple of years as far as Im concerned is the no smoking rules on airplanes and in restaurants And it it really is pleasure for me although I guess smokers dont think that But that
turns.label: sv

turns.text: thats person- thats personal air pollution
personal uh pollution that I can think of
Yeah well I I - definitely advance that Well listen I enjoyed speaking with you
turns.label: aa

turns.text: And lets hope some there are other people that feel the same way
turns.label: fc

turns.text: something happen - Right on thank you
